answers.answer: I think you have to go to a doctor asap..

HelloI know how scare can be to have this things happening to you and you're only 12 :)You  need to talk to  your adult guardian and tell this person (mother or who ever the person is) what is happening, so this person can get you an Doctor appointment.Can be just change of hormones or something else, but is better a doctor check you out, after all this is the reason we have them :) they are  trustworthy  and you gonna be just fine :)

question: I am a 12 year old female with no internal or external health problems as I know. I am experiencing blackouts of vision for seconds at a time from 1 second up to 30 seconds at a time. My eyes are regularly dry and I have to use eye drops. I have family history of graves disease, low thyroid and diabetes. I am wondering if these are symptoms of some kind of disease or something else.
title: Sudden Blackouts in Vision for seconds at a time
